articles.title: 'I will either save us ... or we'll be found together': Mom ties herself to her kids during flood - CNN Video
articles.description: Catastrophic flooding slammed parts of eastern Kentucky, killing at least 37 people. Hear survivors share their stories of devastation as their communities begin to rebuild.

articles.author: Rachel Janfaza, Ethan Cohen, Melissa Holzberg DePalo, Clara Grudberg, Nicholas Anastacio
articles.title: Lt. Gov. Josh Green wins Hawaii Democratic gubernatorial nomination, CNN projects
articles.description: Lt. Gov. Josh Green will win the Democratic nomination for governor in Hawaii, CNN projects.
articles.content:
Lt. Gov. Josh Green will win the Democratic nomination for governor in Hawaii, CNN projects.
As of 7 a.m. ET Sunday, Green was winning 63.7% of the vote, while former Hawaii first lady Vicky Cayetan… [+2286 chars]

articles.author: Mostafa Salem, Eyad Kourdi, Jorge Engels and Hira Humayun, CNN
articles.title: Dozens killed in Egypt church fire
articles.description: At least 41 people were killed, and at least 14 injured after a fire broke out at Abu Sefein church in Cairo's Imbaba neighborhood on Sunday, according to a spokesperson for the Egyptian Coptic Church citing health officials.

articles.author: Julia Buckley
articles.title: Europe's drought could signal the death of river cruising
articles.description: The unprecedented drought in Europe means that cruising on rivers like the Rhine and the Danube looks set to be "a thing of the past." As water levels drop, more and more tourist destinations are drying up.
articles.content: (CNN) Just when you thought it was safe to get back in the pandemic-snarled water, Europe is having another cataclysmic summer. This time, it's not pandemic red tape, but what looks set to be the con… [+13081 chars]

articles.author: Allison Chinchar and Jennifer Gray, CNN Meteorologists
articles.title: One-third of the food we eat is at risk because the climate crisis is endangering butterflies and bees
articles.description: Bee populations are declining. More than half of the bat species in the United States are in severe decline or listed as endangered. And international scientists recently announced the monarch butterfly is perilously close to extinction.

Angela Dewan and Toby Hancock, CNN

articles.title: Apples are baking on branches and hosepipe bans hit millions as England falls into drought
articles.description: The Taylors have been growing apples in the English county of Essex for more than a century. But 2022 has been a particularly tough chapter in the family's history.
articles.content:

articles.author: Payton Major, Judson Jones and Brandon Miller, CNN
articles.title: A disastrous megaflood is coming to California, experts say, and it could be the most expensive natural disaster in history
articles.description: A new study by the journal Science shows climate change has already doubled the chances of a disastrous flood happening in California in the next four decades. And experts say it would be unlike anything anyone, alive today, has ever experienced.

articles.author: Opinion by David A. Andelman
articles.title: Opinion: Cold showers in Germany, France's air conditioning crackdown are signs of Europe's future
articles.description: Most of the European Union faces a toxic confluence of high temperatures, higher energy prices and a Russian threat to cut off gas supplies, writes David A. Andelman, and these nations are putting pressure on their citizens to hold down consumption.
